tense.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a tense situation is one in which you feel very anxious and worried because of something bad that might happen
tense.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Marion spoke, eager to break the tense silence.
tense.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: feeling worried, uncomfortable, and unable to relax
tense.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Is anything wrong? You look a little tense.
tense.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: unable to relax your body or part of your body because your muscles feel tight
tense.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Massage is great if your neck and back are tense.
She tried to relax her tense muscles.
tense.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: any of the forms of a verb that show the time, continuance, or completion of an action or state that is expressed by the verb. ‘I am’ is in the present tense, ‘I was’ is past tense, and ‘I will be’ is future tense.
tense.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to make your muscles tight and stiff, or to become tight and stiff
tense.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: Relax, and try not to tense up so much.
Every time the phone rang, she tensed.
